data.text: When thou wilt do good, know to whom thou doest it;
Do good to the godly man, and thou shalt find a recompense;
There can no good come to him that is always occupied in evil,
Do well unto him that is lowly, but give not to the ungodly:
For the most High hateth sinners,
A friend cannot be known in prosperity:
In the prosperity of a man enemies will be grieved:
Though he humble himself, and go crouching,
Who will pity a charmer that is bitten with a serpent,
So one that goeth to a sinner,
For a while he will abide with thee,
An enemy speaketh sweetly with his lips,
If adversity come upon thee, thou shalt find him there first;
He will shake his head, and clap his hands,
